metadata.title: Luddites, the Industrial Revolution, and the Demographic Transition

relevance.topic: Labor displacement due to technological change
relevance.relevance: The study examines the impact of technological change during the Industrial Revolution on labor, particularly focusing on the displacement of skilled workers by unskilled labor due to new machinery.

dependent_variables.displaced: Skilled workers displaced by unskilled labor due to new machinery
dependent_variables.unemployment_or_underemployment: Skilled workers faced reduced demand and wages
dependent_variables.wage_changes: Wages for skilled workers decreased as unskilled labor was used

text_fragments: 'In none of these cases . . . was there any question of hostility to machines as such. Wrecking was simply a technique of trade unionism'
'The early stages of industrialization had to be unskilled-labor-intensive simply because there were so many more unskilled laborers in the workforce than skilled laborers.'
qualitative_data.narrative_descriptions: The study describes the transition from skilled to unskilled labor during the Industrial Revolution, highlighting the role of technological change in displacing skilled workers.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Post-Malthusian regime with gradual escape from the Malthusian trap
historical_context.institutional_context: Trade unionism and collective bargaining by riot as responses to labor displacement

outcomes.main_findings: Technological change during the Industrial Revolution initially favored unskilled labor, displacing skilled workers. Over time, as basic knowledge increased, there was a shift towards skill-biased technological change.
outcomes.conclusions: The transition from unskilled to skill-biased technological change was driven by economic incentives and the availability of unskilled labor. This transition was gradual and varied across regions and sectors.
outcomes.long_term_impacts: The study suggests that the long-term impact of technological change included a demographic transition with reduced fertility and increased education.

quality_assessment.methodological_limitations: The study relies on historical data and models, which may not capture all nuances of the period.
quality_assessment.coherence: The study provides a coherent narrative linking technological change to labor displacement and demographic shifts.
quality_assessment.adequacy_of_data: The study uses historical data and models to support its conclusions, but the richness of data may be limited by historical records.
quality_assessment.relevance: The study is relevant to understanding the historical context of labor displacement due to technological change.
